page.title: 04ECOLOGY_KINNERTON & EVENJOBB
page.content: KINNERTON AND EVENJOBB ARE IN A HIGH RAINFALL AREA 9OO-2OOO M.M. WITH COLD WINDS. TEMPERATURES IN 1985 WERE 3-4 DEGREES C.JANUARY, 16 C JULY. THE SOIL IS ACID, DRAINAGE EASTWARDS, HIGHEST LAND OVER 12OO' ABOVE SEA LEVEL.OFFA'S DYKE LONG DISTANCE FOOTPATH RUNS FROM BURFA OVER EVENJOBB HILL TO PENOFFA THROUGH FARMLAND OF OUTSTANDING BEAUTY BUZZARDS,KESTRELS,CURLEWS,HAWKS,OWLS, GROUSE,PHEASANTS,LAPWINGS,HERONS,JAYS, MALLARDS & PARTRIDGE ARE AMONGST THE BIRDS FOUND. FOXES,BADGERS,STOATS & WEAZELS ARE COMMON PREDATORS.RABBITS, HEDGEHOGS,BATS,GREY SQUIRRELS ARE OFTEN SEEN,ALSO MANY INSECTS.TOADS, FROGS,NEWTS LIVE IN 4O FARM PONDS. KNOBLEY BROOK IS AN UNPOLLUTED STREAM WITH BULLYHEAD FISH.1O SPRINGS SUPPLY WATER.WILDFLOWERS INCLUDE SNOWDROPS, PRIMROSES,BLUEBELLS,FOXGLOVES,COWSLIPS HAREBELLS,BUTTERCUP,DAISIES & CLOVER.
